A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This movie does not fit with Star Wars as a whole. All of the answers we waited for from The Force Awakens were either not given\, or were given what I consider to be lazy answers. 

Many moments feel forced and out of place\, like a certain love story between two characters\, or someone flying through space after basically dying. 
Decisions about Luke's character are questionable and his end is unsatisfactory. 
Basically\, after seeing this movie\, I have the feeling that I no longer care what happens in this story moving forward. This movie is so disjointed and feels so much like a solo movie that I have no idea what could possibly happen in Episode 9 that I would even be interested in watching. 
It was a decent and very well-shot and pretty movie on the surface\, but underneath it is filled with plot holes\, lazy and forced writing\, and story decisions that just disappoint you. This does NOT feel like Star Wars\, it does NOT fit with the new trilogy\, and it is NOT a good movie overall.
